text: <s>[INST] What is the primary function of engine oil? [/INST] Engine oil lubricates moving parts, reduces friction, cleans engine components, helps cool the engine, and prevents corrosion. </s>
<s>[INST] Why is tire rotation important? [/INST] Tire rotation helps ensure even tread wear across all tires, extending their lifespan and maintaining balanced handling. </s>
<s>[INST] What does a car battery do? [/INST] The battery provides electrical power to start the engine and powers electrical components like lights and radio when the engine is off. </s>

<s>[INST] Explain what brake fluid does. [/INST] Brake fluid is a hydraulic fluid that transfers the force applied to the brake pedal to the brake calipers or wheel cylinders, activating the brakes. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the purpose of windshield washer fluid? [/INST] Windshield washer fluid is used with the wipers to clean dirt, grime, and insects from the windshield for better visibility. </s>

<s>[INST] How does a spark plug work in a gasoline engine? [/INST] A spark plug creates an electrical spark in the combustion chamber to ignite the compressed air-fuel mixture, initiating the power stroke. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the difference between coolant and antifreeze? [/INST] They are often the same thing. Coolant is typically a mixture of antifreeze (usually ethylene glycol or propylene glycol) and water, designed to regulate engine temperature and prevent freezing/boiling. </s>
<s>[INST] What are the signs of a failing car battery? [/INST] Signs include slow engine crank, dim headlights, clicking sound when turning the key, and the need for frequent jump starts. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the purpose of an air filter in a car? [/INST] The engine air filter prevents dust, dirt, and other debris from entering the engine, ensuring clean air for combustion. </s>

<s>[INST] Why should you check your tire pressure regularly? [/INST] Maintaining correct tire pressure ensures optimal handling, fuel efficiency, tire lifespan, and safety by preventing underinflation or overinflation issues. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of a car's alternator? [/INST] The alternator generates electrical power to charge the battery and supply electricity to the vehicle's electrical systems while the engine is running. </s>

<s>[INST] How often should you replace your car's air filter? [/INST] Typically, the air filter should be replaced every 12,000 to 15,000 miles, but this can vary depending on driving conditions and manufacturer recommendations. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the function of a catalytic converter? [/INST] A catalytic converter reduces harmful emissions by converting pollutants in the exhaust gases into less harmful substances like carbon dioxide and water vapor. </s>

<s>[INST] Why is regular oil change important for a car? [/INST] Regular oil changes ensure proper lubrication of engine components, reduce wear and tear, improve engine efficiency, and prevent sludge buildup. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the symptoms of a failing alternator? [/INST] Symptoms include dim or flickering headlights, a dead battery, difficulty starting the car, and unusual noises like grinding or whining. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of a timing belt in an engine? [/INST] The timing belt synchronizes the rotation of the crankshaft and camshaft, ensuring that the engine's valves open and close at the correct times during the intake and exhaust strokes. </s>

<s>[INST] How do you know if your car needs a wheel alignment? [/INST] Signs include uneven tire wear, the car pulling to one side, a crooked steering wheel when driving straight, and vibrations in the steering wheel. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the role of transmission fluid in a car? [/INST] Transmission fluid lubricates and cools the transmission components, ensuring smooth gear shifts and preventing overheating. </s>

<s>[INST] Why is it important to check brake pads regularly? [/INST] Worn brake pads can reduce braking efficiency, increase stopping distance, and damage the brake rotors, leading to costly repairs. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the difference between manual and automatic transmission? [/INST] Manual transmission requires the driver to manually shift gears using a clutch pedal and gear stick, while automatic transmission shifts gears automatically based on speed and load. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the benefits of using synthetic motor oil? [/INST] Synthetic motor oil offers better engine protection, improved performance in extreme temperatures, longer intervals between oil changes, and reduced engine deposits. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the purpose of a car's suspension system? [/INST] The suspension system absorbs shocks from the road, provides stability, and ensures a smooth and comfortable ride. </s>

<s>[INST] How can you tell if your car's tires need replacement? [/INST] Signs include tread depth below 2/32 of an inch, visible cracks or bulges, uneven wear, and frequent loss of air pressure. </s>
<s>[INST] What is the function of a fuel pump in a car? [/INST] The fuel pump delivers fuel from the gas tank to the engine at the correct pressure for combustion. </s>

<s>[INST] Why is it important to flush your car's coolant system? [/INST] Flushing the coolant system removes old coolant, rust, and debris, ensuring proper engine cooling and preventing overheating or corrosion. </s>

<s>[INST] What is the purpose of a car's differential? [/INST] The differential allows the wheels to rotate at different speeds, especially when turning, ensuring smooth handling and reducing tire wear. </s>

<s>[INST] What are the signs of a failing water pump? [/INST] Signs include coolant leaks, engine overheating, a whining noise from the engine, and steam coming from the radiator. </s>
